review: Great for my outdoor TV and the the speed is great/responsive. I use it to connect to my media center to watch live TV and movies in my library. Also built for the techie/power user who would like to sideload other apps for a more robust experience.

review: I've ha problem after problem with these sticks. I originally bought it for $20 on pre-sale. That ones remote stopped working, so they sent me a new unit. This ones remote works but the screen is constantly freezing, and then the screen plays really fast. Other times the sound will go out. I do not have these problems playing Amazon from the TV app, or the Wii, so I am certain the issue is with the stick itself.Save your time and money and buy a different product, of a better quality. Unfortunately these are getting back-ordered regularly so they are manufacturing them so fast they lack a serious level of quality.

review: This is surprisingly an alright device in comparison to Apple TV. Though I did find that it seemed to pull more ban-width than an apple tv to do the same or comparable tasks, the only reason at this time to buy this product if you own an apple tv is to get access directly to your tv for your amazon prime video account and if you don't own a smart tv or smart blu-ray/dvd player which all usually have amazon instant video, so there is little reason to buy this. We bought this only because we received a 50% discount as PRIME members. It looses a star for ui that is more difficult than necessary and non-user friendly, and also for the band-width issue. If I could give a 3.5 star rating I would because I feel it is not as good as others on the market but is slightly better than a Roku which I would give a 1 star.
